title: Job 9:1
text: THEN Job answered and said,

title: Job 9:2
text: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?

title: Job 9:3
text: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.

title: Job 9:4
text: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?

title: Job 9:5
text: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.

title: Job 9:6
text: Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.

title: Job 9:7
text: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.

title: Job 9:8
text: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.

title: Job 9:9
text: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.

title: Job 9:10
text: Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.

title: Job 9:11
text: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.

title: Job 9:12
text: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him?  who will say unto him, What doest thou?

title: Job 9:13
text: If God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.

title: Job 9:14
text: How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him?

title: Job 9:15
text: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.

title: Job 9:16
text: If I had called, and he had answered me; yet would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.

title: Job 9:17
text: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.

title: Job 9:18
text: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.

title: Job 9:19
text: If I speak of strength, lo, he is strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?

title: Job 9:20
text: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.

title: Job 9:21
text: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.

title: Job 9:22
text: This is one thing, therefore I said it, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.

title: Job 9:23
text: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.

title: Job 9:24
text: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof, if not, where, and who is he?

title: Job 9:25
text: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.

title: Job 9:26
text: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.

title: Job 9:27
text: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:

title: Job 9:28
text: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.

title: Job 9:29
text: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?

title: Job 9:30
text: If I wash myself with snow water, and make my hands never so clean;

title: Job 9:31
text: Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.

title: Job 9:32
text: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.

title: Job 9:33
text: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, that might lay his hand upon us both.

title: Job 9:34
text: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:

title: Job 9:35
text: Then would I speak, and not fear him; but it is not so with me.
